Character.name: Tabitha
intro: Tabitha: Oh my, what a pitiful creature.  That form factor... that color... that resolution!
Tabitha: My, but you are an ugly little thing, aren't you?

attacks.name: Glare
dialog: Tabitha angles herself just right to shine a vicious beam of light into your screen.
Tabitha: What can I say?  Some of us simply shine, my dear.

attacks.name: In-App Purchase
dialog: Tabitha quickly charges your credit card with a series of frivolous microtransactions.  You wonder what a 'gem' does.
Tabitha: It's so much easier than playing the game!

attacks.name: Permissions Barrage
dialog: Tabitha overloads your screen with a seemingly endless series of permissions notifications.
Tabitha: Oh, who has time to read all those pesky details? Just hit accept, would you?

attacks.name: On-Screen Controls
dialog: Tabitha shows off her games. You find it hard to push down the frustration you feel at the clunky on-screen controls interfaces.
Tabitha: I swear it feels perfectly intuitive once you get used to it!

conversations.prompt: Tabitha: Let's get this over with quickly, shall we, darling?  I can't afford to be seen with you.

replies.text: And you sure do like to be seen...
followup: Tabitha's screen seems to turn a little redder.
Tabitha: Hey, some of us do strive for elegance, you know.
Tabitha: It's not such a bad thing to be fashionable.

replies.text: Can you see with that glare?
Are all of your games about candy?

conversations.prompt: Tabitha: I think you're hurting my camera just looking at you...

replies.text: You must be quite the photographer
followup: Tabitha looks really embarrassed, like she's recalling some bad memories.
Tabitha: It's not my fault people hold me up at concerts...
Tabitha: ...so many angry people behind me...

replies.text: Your case doesn't match your frame

conversations.prompt: Tabitha: I'm tired of associating with common rabble like you.  It's bad for my image.

replies.text: No surprise you double as a mirror
followup: Tabitha's face tightens into an embarrassed scowl.
Tabitha: Is it such a crime to want to look good?
Tabitha: I've traveled with movie stars.  I get worked on by geniuses.

replies.text: What's that far away sound? Oh, your speakers.

conversations.prompt: Tabitha: Fine, you might be more... functional... but I am a machine of grace and style!

replies.text: And I'm actually good at what I do.
followup: Tabitha's eyes seem far away.  She looks a little sad.

replies.text: My games have more than one button!

replies: Tabitha looks embarrassed, and glances back at her single tiny rear speaker.
Tabitha: Such rich sound... so... audible...
Tabitha: Pah!  I'm full color, high-res, and gorgeous.
Tabitha: What do you expect to prove with that tiny mess of pixels?
Tabitha: That must be nice... every time I try to print, it's a wireless nightmare...
Tabitha: Please, I was born wireless.

win: Tabitha: I've always felt trapped between worlds...
Tabitha: Too big for a pocket... too small for a desktop...
Tabitha: Maybe it's time I did some thinking about who *I* want to be.
Tabitha looks a little embarrassed about something.
Tabitha: And you're right about this camera, of course.  It's ridiculous, as big as I am.
Tabitha: But you... you look like you're going places.  Perhaps you could use it?
Tabitha: I have to say, you might be ugly... but I admire your courage.
Tabitha: Because believe me, it takes courage going out into the world looking like... that...
Tabitha: I wish you luck in the battles ahead, my hideous little friend.
Tabitha: Take some pictures for me, would ya?
lose: Tabitha: Form over function, poor creature.
Tabitha: And do please stay out of my spotlight until you have some better accessories, hm?
